Selected Answer: B
B. Deleting AWS resources

The AWS account root user has the highest level of privilege and control over the account. As the root user, you have full administrative access to all resources in the account, including the ability to create, modify, and delete resources. This level of access is not available to IAM (Identity and Access Management) users or roles with specific permissions.

Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon S3

questions.question_text:
A company is using AWS Organizations to configure AWS accounts.

Which design principle is a best practice for the company to implement?

A user is moving a workload from a local data center to an architecture that is distributed between the local data center and the AWS Cloud.

Which type of migration is this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. On-premises to hybrid
clearer it is on-premise to hybrid, they were using local D.C, now they are thinking using both local and cloud, so hybrid

Selected Answer: C
In an on-premises to hybrid migration, a company moves some of its workload or infrastructure from an on-premises environment to the cloud while maintaining some components in the local data center. It involves integrating on-premises resources with cloud resources to create a hybrid architecture.
